body_html:
Also, try running a simple cuda problem inside the container:

STR=$'#include <cstdio> \n int main() { int n; printf(\"%d\\n\",cudaGetDeviceCount(&n)); }'
echo "$STR" > tmp.cu
nvcc --run tmp.cu

If output is something other than 0, the problem is with the setup (driver?), not with pytorch. In a parallel thread someone suggested just rebooting to get rid of error 30.

body:
Also, try running a simple cuda problem inside the container:
```
STR=$'#include <cstdio> \n int main() { int n; printf(\"%d\\n\",cudaGetDeviceCount(&n)); }'
echo "$STR" > tmp.cu
nvcc --run tmp.cu
```
If output is something other than 0, the problem is with the setup (driver?), not with pytorch. In a parallel thread someone suggested just rebooting to get rid of error 30.
